Title:
A new species of Haploporus (Polyporaceae, Basidiomycota)
from Australia
Abstract:
Abstract: Haploporus australiensis sp. nov. is described
and illustrated from southern Australia. It is characterized by an
annual, resupinate basidiocarps with white to cream fresh pores which
becoming buff-yellow up on drying, indistinct sterile margin, a dimitic
hyphal structure with indextrinoid skeletal hyphae, the presence of
cystidioles which occasionally with a simple septum, the absence of
dendrohyphidia, dissepimental hyphae thick-walled with a simple septum,
and cylindrical, hyaline, thick-walled, indextrinoid, cyanophilous
basidiospores with echinulate ornamentations, 1114 × 5.27 µm. A
molecular study based on the combined ITS (internal transcribed spacer
region) and nLSU (the large nuclear ribosomal RNA subunit) dataset
demonstrated the studied samples formed a new lineage in
Haploporus.
